description: Returns information about the specified Firewall Manager policy.

parameters.name: PolicyId
parameters.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager policy that you want the details for.

nested_items.name: PolicyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyName
nested_items.description: The name of the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyUpdateToken
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for each update to the policy. When issuing a PutPolicy request, the PolicyUpdateToken in the request must match the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version. To get the PolicyUpdateToken of the current policy version, use a GetPolicy request.

nested_items.name: SecurityServicePolicyData
nested_items.description: Details about the security service that is being used to protect the resources.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The service that the policy is using to protect the resources. This specifies the type of policy that is created, either an WAF policy, a Shield Advanced policy, or a security group policy. For security group policies, Firewall Manager supports one security group for each common policy and for each content audit policy. This is an adjustable limit that you can increase by contacting Amazon Web Services Support.

nested_items.name: ManagedServiceData
nested_items.description: Details about the service that are specific to the service type, in JSON format.

Example: DNS_FIREWALL "{\"type\":\"DNS_FIREWALL\",\"preProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-1\",\"priority\":10}],\"postProcessRuleGroups\":[{\"ruleGroupId\":\"rslvr-frg-2\",\"priority\":9911}]}"

nested_items.name: PolicyOption
nested_items.description: Contains the settings to configure a network ACL policy, a Network Firewall firewall policy deployment model, or a third-party firewall policy.

nested_items.name: NetworkFirewallPolicy
nested_items.description: Defines the deployment model to use for the firewall policy.

nested_items.name: FirewallDeploymentModel
nested_items.description: Defines the deployment model to use for the firewall policy. To use a distributed model, set PolicyOption to NULL.

nested_items.name: ThirdPartyFirewallPolicy
nested_items.description: Defines the policy options for a third-party firewall policy.

nested_items.name: FirewallDeploymentModel
nested_items.description: Defines the deployment model to use for the third-party firewall policy.

nested_items.name: NetworkAclCommonPolicy
nested_items.description: Defines a Firewall Manager network ACL policy.

nested_items.name: NetworkAclEntrySet
nested_items.description: The definition of the first and last rules for the network ACL policy.

nested_items.name: FirstEntries
nested_items.description: The rules that you want to run first in the Firewall Manager managed network ACLs.

nested_items.name: IcmpTypeCode
nested_items.description: ICMP protocol: The ICMP type and code.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: ICMP code.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: ICMP type.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol number. A value of '-1' means all protocols.

nested_items.name: PortRange
nested_items.description: TCP or UDP protocols: The range of ports the rule applies to.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The beginning port number of the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The ending port number of the range.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: RuleAction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to allow or deny the traffic that matches the rule.

nested_items.name: Egress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the rule is an egress, or outbound, rule (applied to traffic leaving the subnet). If it's not an egress rule, then it's an ingress, or inbound, rule.

nested_items.name: ForceRemediateForFirstEntries
nested_items.description: Applies only when remediation is enabled for the policy as a whole. Firewall Manager uses this setting when it finds policy violations that involve conflicts between the custom entries and the policy entries.

nested_items.name: LastEntries
nested_items.description: The rules that you want to run last in the Firewall Manager managed network ACLs.

nested_items.name: IcmpTypeCode
nested_items.description: ICMP protocol: The ICMP type and code.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: ICMP code.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: ICMP type.

nested_items.name: Protocol
nested_items.description: The protocol number. A value of '-1' means all protocols.

nested_items.name: PortRange
nested_items.description: TCP or UDP protocols: The range of ports the rule applies to.

nested_items.name: From
nested_items.description: The beginning port number of the range.

nested_items.name: To
nested_items.description: The ending port number of the range.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 network range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation.

nested_items.name: RuleAction
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to allow or deny the traffic that matches the rule.

nested_items.name: Egress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the rule is an egress, or outbound, rule (applied to traffic leaving the subnet). If it's not an egress rule, then it's an ingress, or inbound, rule.

nested_items.name: ForceRemediateForLastEntries
nested_items.description: Applies only when remediation is enabled for the policy as a whole. Firewall Manager uses this setting when it finds policy violations that involve conflicts between the custom entries and the policy entries.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource protected by or in scope of the policy. This is in the format shown in the Amazon Web Services Resource Types Reference. To apply this policy to multiple resource types, specify a resource type of ResourceTypeList and then specify the resource types in a ResourceTypeList.
Amazon Web Services WAF Classic - AWS::ApiGateway::Stage, AWS::CloudFront::Distribution, and AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer.
WAF - AWS::ApiGateway::Stage, AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer, and AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.
Shield Advanced - AWS::ElasticLoadBalancingV2::LoadBalancer, AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer, AWS::EC2::EIP, and AWS::CloudFront::Distribution.
Network ACL - AWS::EC2::Subnet.
Security group usage audit - AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup.
Security group content audit - AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup, AWS::EC2::NetworkInterface, and AWS::EC2::Instance.
DNS Firewall, Network Firewall, and third-party firewall - AWS::EC2::VPC.

nested_items.name: ResourceTypeList
nested_items.description: An array of ResourceType objects. Use this only to specify multiple resource types. To specify a single resource type, use ResourceType.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ResourceTags
nested_items.description: An array of ResourceTag objects.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The resource tag key.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The resource tag value. To specify an empty string value, either don't provide this or specify it as ''.

nested_items.name: ExcludeResourceTags
nested_items.description: If set to True, resources with the tags that are specified in the ResourceTag array are not in scope of the policy. If set to False, and the ResourceTag array is not null, only resources with the specified tags are in scope of the policy.

nested_items.name: RemediationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates if the policy should be automatically applied to new resources.

nested_items.name: DeleteUnusedFMManagedResources
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Firewall Manager should automatically remove protections from resources that leave the policy scope and clean up resources that Firewall Manager is managing for accounts when those accounts leave policy scope. For example, Firewall Manager will disassociate a Firewall Manager managed web ACL from a protected customer resource when the customer resource leaves policy scope.

nested_items.name: IncludeMap
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational units (OUs) to include in the policy. Specifying an OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a later time.
Specify account IDs by setting the key to ACCOUNT. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ACCOUNT' : ['accountID1', 'accountID2']}.
Specify OUs by setting the key to ORG_UNIT. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ORG_UNIT' : ['ouid111', 'ouid112']}.
Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ACCOUNT' : ['accountID1', 'accountID2'], 'ORG_UNIT' : ['ouid111', 'ouid112']}.

nested_items.name: ExcludeMap
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon Web Services account IDs and Organizations organizational units (OUs) to exclude from the policy. Specifying an OU is the equivalent of specifying all accounts in the OU and in any of its child OUs, including any child OUs and accounts that are added at a later time.
Specify account IDs by setting the key to ACCOUNT. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ACCOUNT' : ['accountID1', 'accountID2']}.
Specify OUs by setting the key to ORG_UNIT. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ORG_UNIT' : ['ouid111', 'ouid112']}.
Specify accounts and OUs together in a single map, separated with a comma. For example, the following is a valid map: {'ACCOUNT' : ['accountID1', 'accountID2'], 'ORG_UNIT' : ['ouid111', 'ouid112']}.

nested_items.name: ResourceSetIds
nested_items.description: The unique identifiers of the resource sets used by the policy.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PolicyDescription
nested_items.description: Your description of the Firewall Manager policy.

nested_items.name: PolicyStatus
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the policy is in or out of an admin's policy or Region scope.
ACTIVE - The administrator can manage and delete the policy.

OUT_OF_ADMIN_SCOPE - The administrator can view the policy, but they can't edit or delete the policy. Existing policy protections stay in place. Any new resources that come into scope of the policy won't be protected.

nested_items.name: ResourceTagLogicalOperator
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to combine multiple resource tags with AND, so that a resource must have all tags to be included or excluded, or OR, so that a resource must have at least one tag.

nested_items.name: PolicyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified policy.
